text:
I am implementing table of contents client side in javascript…
because jekyll sucks.
I think I will move to Franklin with the next release once it uses CommonMark.jl
Since I don’t trust the the Markdown stdlib to handle many of my existing blog posts correctly.

elements.text:
I am implementing table of contents client side in javascript…
because jekyll sucks.
I think I will move to Franklin with the next release once it uses CommonMark.jl
Since I don’t trust the the Markdown stdlib to handle many of my existing blog posts correctly.

text:
Though even CommonMark.jl doesn’t support just sticking HTML in places.

I don’t want to change my markdown posts to something that is nonstandard …

text: have you looked at Jekyll plugins?

text: There's also this approach which should work with GitHub Pages: <https://stackoverflow.com/questions/38417624/table-of-contents-using-jekyll-and-kramdown>

attachments.title: Table of contents using Jekyll and Kramdown
attachments.text: I'm trying to use Kramdown's auto "Table of Contents" generator on a page (not a post) on my Jekyll site. _includes/toc.html <nav> <h4>Table of Contents</h4> {:toc} </nav...
attachments.fallback: Stack Overflow: Table of contents using Jekyll and Kramdown

elements.text: There's also this approach which should work with GitHub Pages:

text:
GitHub Pages's built in Jekyllsucks.
Super out of date version of Jekyll.
Idk if it supports kramdown any more. They messed with what it supported a few years back.
Maybe it only supports kramdown now.

I really need to move to building my site on GHA and deploying HTML.
Would also get better error messages.
